data.title: Truncate 'Open Recent' suggestions from left to right

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1 (32 bit)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder with a long file path
2. Open another folder with a long file path that only differs at the end

If you have multiple recently opened folders that have long, mostly similar file paths, the current implementation of Open Recent will truncate from right to left; leaving you with multiple identical file paths and no way to tell which one is which. 

There are multiple possible solutions: 
-Truncating left to right starting with drive letter would work for my issue, but would make it impossible to tell which version of a file you are opening if you have multiple copies across different drives.
-Removing the middle of the path, showing the drive letter and the last few folder layers could be a better option.
-Allowing this setting to be configurable would prevent any fix breaking some workflows.
-Showing the full file path when a selection is highlighted/hovered over would at least allow you to know for certain which folder you are opening no matter what configuration you have.
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Include command id in error message
data.body: An error is thrown if an extension attempts to register a command with an id that already exists. This very small PR makes the error more helpful by including the id of the already existing command.

data.title: Feature Request: Add "problems.exclude" setting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: We have `files.exclude` which removes any ability to reference a file within the Workspace, as well as `search.exclude` to hide from search. In my case, I want to be able to view and search files within `vendor` directories, so I have not added them to either of the exclude settings, but as a result row upon row of issues flood the problems panel, which hide problems within my own code. It would be great to be able to exclude these directories only from appearing in the problems panel with a `problems.exclude` setting, which would still allow them to be used for search, go to definition and intellisense etc.

data.title: Test: Docker Extension
data.body:
**Complexity:** 2

**OS**: 
- [x] Linux (see [the readme](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docker/blob/master/README.md#running-commands-on-linux) on how to set up docker on Linux) @weinand
- [x] Mac @bpasero 
- [x] Windows @seanmcbreen 

## Issues
Please file issues in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-docker/issues

## Setup
Install docker ...
Get the extension bits ...
``` console
git clone https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-docker
cd vscode-docker && npm install
vsce package
code-insiders --install-extension vscode-docker-0.0.16.vsix 
```

## Summary
The latest Docker extension adopts the [Docker Language Server](https://github.com/rcjsuen/dockerfile-language-server-nodejs) and adds an Explorer contribution which lets you view and manage images and containers (running images). Dockerlint was removed and so were snippets in favor of the language server. 

The extension was refactored to support using the same commands for both the explorer and the command palette. For example, if you invoke a "start" command on an Image in the explorer, that Image will be run. If you invoke a "Start" command from the command palette you'll get a quick pick of images to start.

## Test

**Language Server**
Create dockerfile and docker-compose files for Node or C# or Go workspaces. Validate IntelliSense/Completions, validation, etc.  Validate that the various `docker.languageserver.diagnostics.*` settings work.

> Note that IntelliSense for DockerHub images has been [temporarily] removed in favor of adopting the language server.

**Images**
Download and/or create local images, make sure they show up in the Explorer. Right click on the explorer to manipulate, start, stop, etc. images. Changes to images done through the terminal show up in the explorer, and vice versa. Run the same sets of commands via the Command Palette instead of the Explorer.

**Containers**
Running and stopped containers should show up with different icons in the explorer. Right click to manipulate containers, make modifications to containers from the terminal and ensure they are reflected in the explorer. Run the same set(s) of commands via the Command Palette.

**Bonus**
Set up your machine to talk to a remote docker daemon. Everything should continue to work, but I've never tried this :)

data.title: New triggers for extension recommendations
data.body: `getRecommendations` is updated to send the type of recommendation along with the recommendations themselves. This will help with adding the appropriate telemetry tag to track which kind of recommendations were installed.

data.title: Keybinding for applying a specific code action
data.body:
**Problem**
Some code actions, such as extract method, may be used very often. This currently requires too many steps:

1. Highlight expression to be extracted
1. Use `editor.action.quickFix` shortcut
1. Select `Extract method` from list of quick fixes and press enter.

**Desired Flow**
User creates a keybinding:

```
{
    "key": "cmd+r,m",
    "command": "editor.action.applyQuickFix",
    "arguments": ["extract"]
}
```

1. Highlight expression to be extracted
1. Press `ctrl+r, m`


**Complications**
1. Multiple extract method options may exist. In this case, I think we'd want to display a list of all possible extract code actions

1. Ideally the same shortcuts should work across languages

data.title: Hover MarkedString value undefined
data.body:
Latest master, build from source code, hover on a color and get exception

```
index.js:44 TypeError: Cannot read property 'replace' of undefined
Please report this to https://github.com/chjj/marked.
    at Lexer.lex (file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/base/common/marked/raw.marked.js:140:5)
    at Function.Lexer.lex (file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/base/common/marked/raw.marked.js:131:16)
    at Object.marked (file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/base/common/marked/raw.marked.js:1221:31)
    at Object.renderMarkdown (file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/base/browser/htmlContentRenderer.js:137:38)
    at file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/editor/contrib/hover/browser/modesContentHover.js:242:70
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/editor/contrib/hover/browser/modesContentHover.js:241:26
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at ModesContentHoverWidget._renderMessages (file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/editor/contrib/hover/browser/modesContentHover.js:232:22)
    at ModesContentHoverWidget._withResult (file:///Users/penlv/code/vscode/out/vs/editor/contrib/hover/browser/modesContentHover.js:220:22)
```

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/hover/browser/modesContentHover.ts#L319 we received 3 hover messages here, one is ColorHover, one is `{value: "xxx", enableCommands: true}` and the one breaking marked is `{enableCommands: true}`. Not sure how the value property is missing.

data.title: Extension Dev: Opening files without triggering an onDidOpen event for other extensions
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
In reference to this thread: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15723

I'd like to implement a "Scan all" command in my extension, that scans all of the relevant files in the workspace.  The easiest way to do this is to call workspace.OpenTextDocument, but doing so triggers an onDidOpen event that a lot of extensions listen for.  The result is that the "Problems" window doesn't just get the output of the analysis my own extension produces, but the output for every extension that generates problems and listens to the onDidOpen event.  Ideally I wouldn't inundate my users with output for other extensions when running a command for my own extension.  

I don't need the onDidOpen event myself (I can just do a client.sendRequest in the "then" of openTextDocument to trigger my own analysis).  Is there any chance @dbaeumer that you changed your stance from the previous thread and there is now some mechanism to open a file without triggered an onDidOpen? I would argue that there is a difference between the user opening a file in the UI, and an extension opening a file that is never displayed in the UI.  In the latter case, probably doesn't make sense for anyone but that extension to know it opened (i.e. be able to suppress sending onDidOpen to any other extensions).

thanks

data.title: Color code file tabs by folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0-insider

As a developer who loves the new ability to support multiple folders in a single workspace and who often has many files open from many folders, it would be nice to have a visual queue to identify which of my many open files come from which folders so I can more easily spot the files I'm interested in working on. 

**Acceptance criteria**
* For example, I'd like my AuthService folder as have a light green background, and the tabs of files opened from the AuthService folder should also be light green.
* The color would ideally be set in workspace settings or user settings.
* The color would ideally take a theme color or a manual hex or rgba color.  Setting transparency level (rgba) might be especially nice for this feature.

data.title: Extremely Slow Mouse Scrolling when Updating Highlighted Selection
data.body:
Scroll drops to a crawl (less than one line per scroll "click") when also updating a highlight from the mouse. Scrolling speed is not affected when not actively updating a highlight area, including when a highlight exists on the screen. Scroll speed is not affected when updating a highlight area by using mouse position (i.e. side of the screen), indicating that this bug is related only to mouse scrolling, not to draw computations of updating the highlight.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Insiders 1.16.0-insiders (1c6f2f9a8012565adcc50616c3aa90cb444e8797)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any file.
2. Highlight some content with mouse
3. Continue to hold mouse button and attempt to scroll

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Extension List (all disabled at once, issue still reproduces):
* Git Lens
* mssql
* TSLint
* vscode-icons
